I like social studies but I'm also good in science. Making a choice between the two is confusing to me. I wish I could just do them both.

Choosing what to do in life

Pinto had a childhood friend named Paltu. she usually comes to school in a rolls royce car which was an unique blue design one. No two cars will have a same design or colour  in rolls royce brand. Once pinto's father got transferred to new city, he lost his touch with Paltu. one fine day when he was going to his new school, he saw a rolls royce car which looked exactly like paltu's car standing in the school. He decided....

options.option: it was not paltu's car as he moved to a different city.
it was paltu's car as he remembers the  blue design very well
It may not be paltu's car as there are many cars with same colours and designs
It could be paltu's car as we can travel to new city with cars

question_body: The Value of 0 is high when it is

options.option: compare the sizes of mangoes and remove the smaller or bigger ones
Check if all the fruits inside the box are actually mangoes if not remove that particular fruit
compare the colours of mangoes and remove the darker or lighter ones
compare the quality of mangoes and remove the rotten or older ones
Can't Judge misfit untill explanation for misfit is provided

question_body: Arjun is unable to find enough time for his studies. No matter how much he tries he ends up spending all his time on video games. what  shall be followed to improve his studies Course of action:- Plan 1. Arjun's parents should take back his mobile phone.Plan 2. Arjun should have a set time for playing games and for studying.Plan 3. Arjun should study whenever he gets time

The stadium was packed when we entered. My dad and I were looking for our seats and I could see a few volunteers trying to control the excited crowd. My dad had brought a scarf with his favourite player's name on it for cheering them. We had a lot of fun. It was an eventful evening.

Which would be the best title for the paragraph given below? 

"On a bright and sunny summer morning, Mrs. Roy decided to take her kids out for a fun trip to the waterpark. Mr. Roy had to leave for his office so, Mrs. Roy excitedly agreed to take the kids herself. The two Roy kids, Kiara aged eight and Rahul aged 11 were very happy about this surprise plan. The three of them got into their car and Mrs. Roy drove them to the waterpark. There all the three of them had much fun enjoying the joy rides and playing in water. By the time they got back home it was dusk and even Mr. Roy had returned from his office. The kids couldn’t stop talking about their lovely time at te waterpark and asked their father to go along with them the next time."

options.option: The Roy's Fun day at the Waterpark

question_body: What among the following always has the colours green, red, brown in it.
What is the appropriate way to think during difficult situations?

options.option: I can always achieve no matter what happens!
I may or may not be able to do it, but I will try my best!
I don't think it's very easy to do this and that is okay.
What happens is not in my control.

question_body: Mother scolds whenever I make a mistake. Which statement is most appropriate?

options.option: It is right to scold me whenever I make a mistake
Scolding is okay sometimes when I make a mistake
Mistakes happen, I should not be scolded for it.

question_body: Mahesh is worried about not doing well in his exam, even though he has prepared well. What should be his appropriate thought to this?

options.option: It is good to be worried, we never know what will happen in the exam.
There is no point in worrying, since there is nothing he can do about it now.
He should be a little confident in his preparation and perform how much ever he can.
He should be worried, because it will push him to do better.

question_body: If you were to write a story about a small boy, how would you end the story?

options.option: I would make it a horror story.
I would make him a multi-millionaire.
I would make him grow into an old man
I would make him a happy & successful human being

question_body: Find the odd one out
Which of this statement looks true to you

options.option: It is easy to create whatever we think in our mind
It is easy to create at least few things which come in our mind
It is not easy to find a new way or different way to do the things which we do regularly

question_body: You are having a birthday party. But you forgot to invite some people. How would you invite them for the party?

options.option: Apologize for the delay and offer them help to reach the party.
Send a WhatsApp invite and hope they will come.
Call them for the next party, since it's late already.
Tell them the previous invite got lost and invite them again

question_body: You need to prepare for your exam at the last minute. What is the best thing to do?

options.option: I need to check and study only the important topics.
I will study whatever I can before the time runs out.
It's not possible to study in such a short time, I will skip the exam.

question_body: Your teacher says you aren't good in this subject. What will you do?

options.option: I am not good at it, I will stop studying this subject and focus on other subjects.
I will try my best to study better, but I cant control how my teacher grades me.
I will go join the tuition
I will ask my teacher where exactly I need to improve and I will work on it.

question_body: Which of the following is true?

options.option: People with specs are very clumsy
1st rankers always get the best job.

question_body:
What among the following are positive statements-
1. I can do anything if people help me.
2. I choose to be happy. 
3. I am worthy of all the love people give me. 
4. I am surely help you but you need to give me chocolate. 
5. My parents are amazing when they get me gifts.

What among the following are negative statements-
1. It is okay to take a break.
2. Stop doing things that waste your time. 
3. This work is impossible to do 
4. Some people can never complete this task
5. She cannot learn this subject
When we dont get what we want, we should-

options.option: Take what is given to me.
Be patient and explain why I want it.

question_body: When we see a difficult question in exam we should-

options.option: Ask my friend for the answer
Skip the question and attempt it at last by myself
Try my best to complete it and only then move to the next question.

question_body: When asked to give a public speech we -

options.option: Make excuses and skip my turn.
Will feel nervous but still give it a try.
Will not give it because I don't like it.
Give the chance to another person

question_body: What would be the appropriate way to act or behave in a social place (Family Function, Community, Locality, School Etc)?

options.option: Do whatever we like, provided it doesn't disturb or hurt others
Do only things which are liked by others
Do whatever we like to do

question_body: Diana was traveling to the nearby town to meet her friend after 10 years. While walking on a lonely street at night by 10 pm, she suddenly felt someone touch her shoulder from behind. She would be ……… initially
Anaya wants to please her friend to do a favor for Anaya. Which expression should she use when asking for the favor?

Shanvik was riding his bicycle and suddenly a dog came fiercely near him and barked at him. He applied the brakes, but due to bad road, the cycle skidded off the road and fell down causing an injury in his leg. What are all the possible feelings that he would feel now?

options.option: Feel angry at the dog as it made him fall down
Feel feared that the dog may bite him
Feel happy that the dog did not bite him
Feel sad that his injury may cause severe pain

question_body: How do we need to do to convey our emotions to others?

options.option: Express your feelings in the right way and not disturb others around
Shout hard about how you are feeling to make people notice you
Stay silent and not express your emotions at all
Express your emotions with violent behavior

question_body: How do we express how we feel, so that others can understand?

options.option: Use the strong emotions and be stubborn because people should understand how you feel
Don’t express your emotions as people around us are not going to understand how you feel
Keep repeating how you feel until people listen
Express using the right facial reactions so they don't misunderstand how you feel.

question_body: What would be the best way to express how you feel to others?

options.option: Express your strong emotions at the right place & time.
Express your emotions with a lot of smile
Never express your emotions. They won't understand anyway.
Forcefully tell them how you feel, since they have to listen.

question_body:

What was the person talking about?
How did the person sound?

Your friend is angry and doesn't want to talk to you. You know why she is angry, but the mistake is not on your side. How would you respond to her?

options.option: I know you are angry, but I don't care about it.
I understand you are angry, I will give you some time alone.
I am going to complain to your mom, it's your fault.

question_body: Listen to the audio. What did Anaaya do wrong while talking to her mother?

options.option: Her mom did not like her asking for the dish

question_body: You want your mom to cook your favorite food. How would you ask her for it?

options.option: Mom, I feel like eating that dish. Make it for me today!
Mom, its been soo many days since you made that dish. It would be nice if you can make it today.
Mom, why don't you make this dish today?
Mom, I am craving to eat this. Would it be possible for you to make it today for me?

question_body: What is the best way to genuinely ask for a favor?

options.option: I hope you can do this for me.
Could you please do this for me?
I want you to do this for me.
Can you do this for me?

question_body: You get into your school van, and see someone else sitting in your place. You look around and there is no place for you to sit. What will you tell him/her to get yourself seated?

options.option: There is no place anyway so I won't say anything.
Get up from that place. It is mine
I used to sit there, so are you open to move a little and adjust the space with me?
I used to sit there, so can you please get up?

question_body: You have difficulty understanding what your friend is trying to say. what will you tell him?

options.option: Kindly explain it to me clearly again. I find it difficult to understand
What you are saying might be right, but I don't understand.

question_body: Look at the video. Why was Rachana (the leader) removed from the team?

options.option: Because she was doing all the work by herself
She was late to the meeting
She did not work along with the team
She was not doing any work

question_body: Who was a good team player?
What was the good quality portrayed in the story?
Your teammate (Karan) doesn't understand the work given to him by the leader. What will you do?

options.option: It is better to inform the teammates about his inefficiency.
Explain the work and help him.
Not do anything, and let him find his own way.

question_body: Your best friend Nisha is in the same project team as yours. But she is not working properly in the team project. What will you do?

options.option: Tell her that she has duties to do as a part of this team and request her to work.
She has helped me in many things before, so it is okay.
Ask her to work or she might be removed from the team.
Suggest the team leader to remove her/him from team directly.

question_body: You are asked to pair up with a classmate, by your teacher, to complete the activity list for the day. But you find it difficult to work with that classmate. What would you do?

options.option: Ask for a new partner to the teacher
It is just for a day. I will try my best to complete the work with that person.
I might let my partner do the work because we aren't working well together.
I will convey the difficulty to my partner and try to sort out the differences.

question_body: You and your teammate Amisha want to do the same drawing as your contribution for the class project. She is not ready to change her idea. What will you do?

options.option: We are a team. So I will change my idea and come up with a new drawing.
I don't think I will change because I can draw better than Amisha.
I will not take part in the project, since I can't do anything else.
Talk to her and see if we can share the work.

question_body: It's sports day and you are about to play finals kho-kho. Your friend gets hurt before the game. What will you do?

options.option: Get frustrated and angry at her. Because this will make the chances of losing high
Check with her if she can adjust and play.
Tell your PT teacher about it
Discuss with your team and alter the game strategy.

question_body: You are a part of the team and you are given a work. Due to some reasons you aren't able to do it. What will you do?

options.option: Tell my leader I will do it later
Even if I don't do it, no problem! Someone else will do it. It has happened before.
Ask for some more time and complete it myself

question_body: Anita is smart, but mean. Akilan is disciplined, but poor in math. Keshav is kind, but does not have team skills. Who do you think will be the best leader out of the three?
What can be done by a team leader to reach the team goal quickly?

options.option: Use the power as a leader and force people to complete work
Give special treatment to friends and ask them to make rules
Choose people based on their talent- to complete the works
Help other students and guide them to complete work

question_body: What qualities must a great class leader have?

options.option: Be a good example and help others to achieve their targets or goals
Carefully watch how the team performs and write down their mistakes
Everyone knows what to do, so just let them be free.
Support the people who work properly and complain about people who don’t do the work properly

question_body: Sonali wants to become the class leader. What does she need to do for that?

options.option: She needs to top the class
She needs to make more friends
She needs to help everyone in class even though she might not like them

question_body: During the exam, Shyam's best friend asked him the answer to one question. How should Rajit respond?

options.option: Ignore him and later after the exam is over, politely convey to him that it is wrong to cheat.

question_body: How will you convince your teacher to become a class / team leader?

options.option: Tell that I am popular and I have a lot of friends
Tell that I look nice and people will listen to me
Tell that I can understand people
Tell that I do my classworks and homeworks properly

question_body: Which is the right way to go about being a leader?

options.option: Get to know your group-> make a plan-> delegate work properly-> reach goal
Make a plan-> Get to know your group-> reach goal
Make a plan-> delegate work-> reach goal
Get to know your group-> delegate work-> make a plan-> reach goal

question_body: In which of the situations is the role of a leader very important?
When someone doesn't listen to you, as a leader how will you respond?

options.option: Complain about them to the teacher
Fight with them and prove you are right
Tell them you are the leader and they must listen
Ask them why they aren't listening and find a way to help them
It is okay if they don't listen. You will ask someone else to do the work
